\section{simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key}
\label{\detokenize{model:simple-sql-model-foreign-key}}\index{ForeignKey (class in simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key)@\spxentry{ForeignKey}\spxextra{class in simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{model:simple_sql.model.foreign_key.ForeignKey}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{ForeignKey}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{from\_column}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{to\_column}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{on\_delete\_cascade}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{bool} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Describes a foreign key, the string form of this object is the
string that declares a foreign key with MySQL compliant syntax.
The table of the referencing column is not passed because it is
handled inside the creation of the relative Table object.
\index{\_\_from\_column (simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key.ForeignKey attribute)@\spxentry{\_\_from\_column}\spxextra{simple\_sql.model.foreign\_key.ForeignKey attribute}}

\begin{quote}\begin{description}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{to\_column}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}) \textendash{} String of type table.column, represent the column that is referenced by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{from\_column}}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{on\_delete\_cascade}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default False}}) \textendash{} Itâ€™s True if the reference should cascade on delete

\end{itemize}

\item[{Raises}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{SyntaxError}} \textendash{} If the to\_column is not identified as table.column

\end{description}\end{quote}

\section{simple\_sql.model.table}
\label{\detokenize{model:simple-sql-model-table}}\index{Table (class in simple\_sql.model.table)@\spxentry{Table}\spxextra{class in simple\_sql.model.table}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{model:simple_sql.model.table.Table}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{simple\_sql.model.table.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Table}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{metadata}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{MetaData}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{name}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{str}}, \emph{\DUrole{o}{*}\DUrole{n}{columns\_and\_foreign}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{List}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{if\_not\_exists}\DUrole{p}{:} \DUrole{n}{bool} \DUrole{o}{=} \DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Describes a table, the string form of this object is the
string that declares a table with MySQL compliant syntax.
Columns, references and primary keys are created using the
string representation of the column and foreign key objects.
Inside checks to ensure foreign key compatibility are handled
here
\index{\_\_columns (simple\_sql.model.table.Table attribute)@\spxentry{\_\_columns}\spxextra{simple\_sql.model.table.Table attribute}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{*columns\_and\_foreign}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{List}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}{\hyperref[\detokenize{model:simple_sql.model.column.Column}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Column}}}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Foreign}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} Contains columns and foreign keys of this table.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{if\_not\_exists}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{default True}}) \textendash{} True if the table should include IF NOT EXISTS clause.

\end{itemize}

\item[{Raises}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ZeroColumns}} \textendash{} If no columns are provided to the constructor.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{NoSuchColumn}} \textendash{} If a foreign key is relative to a non\sphinxhyphen{}existent column.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{PrimaryKeyError}} \textendash{} If no columns are flagged as primary keys.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ForeignKeyError}} \textendash{} If a foreign key is relative to a non\sphinxhyphen{}existent column.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
